metadata.synopsis: Astarion talks to Dark Urge Avatar.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: You are spasming and twitching... You poor thing.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: I have almost no memory from before I awoke on the nautiloid.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Something awful is brewing within... I know not what.

70.speaker: Astarion
70.text: Hmmm... So far my tadpole and I have been nothing but best friends. Something else is happening to you, isn't it?

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: You have bouts of swooning and swaying, and your jaw is grinding like you're poised to chew off your tongue.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Overwhelming violent desires fester in my skull.

31.speaker: Astarion
31.text: The norm is to keep dirty thoughts like that to ourselves. But do carry on.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: These cruel thoughts... they aren't me. Something has cursed me.

97.speaker: Astarion
97.text: It seems you have been dealt a vile hand... I say: play it. Play it for all it's worth.

131.speaker: Astarion
131.text: Nobody should deny themselves of their true nature.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: A feeling deep inside possesses me and whispers murder, over and over.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I don't want to confide in you if you won't take me seriously.

6.speaker: Astarion
6.text: What did you think I was going to say? 'Oh, come here, I'll kiss you better'?

59.speaker: Astarion
59.text: Bhaal himself has sentenced you to an eternity of madness, to be consumed by your Urge.

88.speaker: Astarion
88.text: You'll never be free, will you? He is going to take over...

60.speaker: Astarion
60.text: I've had periods where I was so hungry, I was all but robbed of speech and reason.

109.speaker: Astarion
109.text: If you become as I fear... feral, scrabbling, all but a carrion-creature... I don't think I'll be able to look at you. It will remind me too much of my worst self.

107.speaker: Astarion
107.text: If that is to be your fate, I will enjoy our time together while it lasts. But soon enough we'll have to say our goodbyes.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Don't say that. I'm so scared.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: No matter what he does to my brain, I won't forget you.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: The time we have together now is so precious.

106.speaker: Astarion
106.text: In a thousand years, when I've all but forgotten how to love yet again, you'll flit back into my heart, and I'll weep wondering what happened to my mad love.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: Good morning! Thank you for not killing me the other night.

89.speaker: Astarion
89.text: Are you all right now, or is today a 'I will wed you with a delicate veil of blood blooming over your white curls' kind of day?

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I'm so worried about you. What if I get possessed again?

130.speaker: Astarion
130.text: I'm also worried about me, but I seem to somehow be worried about you more.

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: You give me something to care for, and that's worth the peril.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Do you really still believe I can get better?

114.speaker: Astarion
114.text: Why not? If I can walk in the sun, you can become all sunshine and roses. I'm sure of it.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: We're safe for now, as far as I can tell.

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: Excellent. You will let me know the next time you need to be tied up, won't you?

40.speaker: Player
40.text: This only happened because I care for you.

133.speaker: Astarion
133.text: Just as the lick of poison is removed from my words of love, yours become a sentence of death. A tragic pair, eh?

92.speaker: Astarion
92.text: At least the smut-peddlers of Sharess' Caress will have a field day writing erotic verse about us when we're both dead.

79.speaker: Astarion
79.text: Well done again on besting Bhaal and all that. It was very twee.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: Especially the part where that poor excuse for a skeleton waved his magic wand and made it all better.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: I am myself at last. You don't need to fear anything from me ever again.

83.speaker: Astarion
83.text: Yes, you were so very scary.

68.speaker: Astarion
68.text: I knew you had that sweet heart all along. I was alarmed by you sometimes, scandalised even, but somehow by your side, I still only ever saw you.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I can't thank you enough for protecting me when Bhaal came to call. Now I can protect you.

1.speaker: Astarion
1.text: I have the utmost confidence you would do the same for me.

98.speaker: Astarion
98.text: Now excuse me while I go and regurgitate the sap rankling in my throat.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Thanks. There was a part where I really thought I wasn't going to make it.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: Dying and being reborn is never pleasant.

101.speaker: Astarion
101.text: The beast you turn into... as charming as it is...

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Just make sure those claws don't come anywhere near me.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Bask in the Slayer's unwashed radiance!

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: Erm, yes. It does smell the part.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I promise I can control it...

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Oh don't bother, not on my account, anyway. Let it roam free. You make quite the pretty pitfiend.

102.speaker: Astarion
102.text: The Urges are calling on you again, aren't they? I haven't seen you sleep through the night once in the past days.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I had a vision: I found out I'm a Bhaalspawn.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Don't be alarmed... but I've divined with near certainty that Lord Bhaal is my Father.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: Well, it certainly sheds some light on the sleepless night you spent tied up, trying to slit my throat. Bloody hells, a Bhaalspawn.

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: I knew you had some nasty habits, but I didn't want to pry overmuch. But, bloody hells, a Bhaalspawn?

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Probably more Baldurian parents scare their children with stories of your kind than mine.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: I thought your kind was extinct. Goes to show, you should always check your facts.

110.speaker: Astarion
110.text: So... how are you feeling? Keen to reconnect with your family? Or ready to throw yourself in an oubliette?

119.speaker: Player
119.text: I'm very afraid. How can I stand up to a god? He wants me to cause carnage.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: You know, I didn't realise you and I were so alike.

84.speaker: Astarion
84.text: I - I felt paralysed to do anything about Cazador for so many decades.

95.speaker: Astarion
95.text: I gave up on myself. I gave up on any hope of escape after a few lashes.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: Bhaal controls you in much the same way.

45.speaker: Astarion
45.text: I don't know how you can beat him, but I do know this: you must try.

36.speaker: Astarion
36.text: The half-life of a mind-addled slave is worse than death - don't become his. I wouldn't live another century as one for all the moonstones in Evereska.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I suspected it all along, in earnest.

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: You know, though I don't look a day over a hundred, I was alive in Baldur's Gate when the Bhaalspawn first arose.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: I was barely aware of it - locked in the kennels as a young spawn.

9.speaker: Astarion
9.text: Rather thrilling I get to watch the bloodshed first hand. I felt very unfashionable, missing out last time.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I must do Father's bidding. My body forcibly compels me. You've seen it.

27.speaker: Astarion
27.text: Oh, gods, we're going to get into 'Father' this, 'progeny' that all day and night, aren't we?

118.speaker: Player
118.text: I will find a way to resist.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Bhaal became impotent two hundred years ago, before the time of Sarevok... I don't even know how I was conceived.

16.speaker: Astarion
16.text: Ugh. I'm not listening to this. You can worship your Father's emissions in your own head.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: There's still so much I don't know... that I might never know before it's too late.

103.speaker: Astarion
103.text: Just so you know, I don't judge you for what happened to that bard, Alfira.

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: But the look of guilt on your face was priceless.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I didn't do it, I swear. Something strange is happening to me.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: I don't care, really. But you could have been more subtle about it.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I'm glad you had fun watching me sweat.

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: It seems the Father issues are only just beginning, eh?

5.speaker: Astarion
5.text: The choice is made. You'll never stop killing.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: When I conquer the world over, perhaps I shall spare you.

12.speaker: Astarion
12.text: You're going to sit nicely in my lap - perhaps naked - as I give orders to our nocturnal horde from my palace throne.

77.speaker: Astarion
77.text: Bhaal's army will be an unsurpassable dowry. I cannot wait for you to claim it.

14.speaker: Astarion
14.text: Not if I get there first. The game is on, darling.

76.speaker: Astarion
76.text: I lived through the downfall of Sarevok. I'll believe in the rise of Bhaal when I see it.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I know you saw me tell Bhaal I would subdue the earth... I only said that because I was forced.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: If the only way to control his possession is to bow to it, I suppose that is how it must be.

22.speaker: Astarion
22.text: Tut tut. We're all friends here, aren't we?

124.speaker: Astarion
124.text: Ssh, or I'll rush off and tell your Father you've been fibbing. Did he spank you growing up, or go straight for the cat-o'-nine?

129.speaker: Player
129.text: I'm sorry, I wasn't strong enough to stand against him.

120.speaker: Astarion
120.text: Servitude or death. You didn't have a choice.

112.speaker: Astarion
112.text: Did we really have to kill the Moonmaiden's servant?

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I'm so sorry for killing her... My instincts called upon me, and I was afraid.

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: I won't weep for her, but we could have used her as leverage instead. Sometimes we need to think with our heads before our knives, dear.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Didn't you enjoy watching Last Light burn?

128.speaker: Astarion
128.text: Watching you make decisions is rather like watching a tarrasque mating ritual. One simply assumes villages will be destroyed in the process.

51.speaker: Astarion
51.text: You'll have to go quite a bit further to surprise me.
